bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Isaac Newton Campbell was a native of Rockbridge County, American Civil War veteran, and graduate of Washington and Lee in 1874. Later he became a Presbyterian minister. He lived in Grottoes and Port Republic, Virginia and in Lincoln County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Isaac Newton Campbell kept this notebook while a student at Washington and Lee University and at Campbell's Divinity School. It consists primarily of his notes on Greek grammar from Professor James Jones White's class at Washington and Lee and notes on biblical history from T.E. Peck's classes at divinity school. Includes a poem about Professor White.
